body_html:
@boeddeker , thanks for that information. I'll take a look.

@carlthome , generating a batch is significantly slower than a single training step, so unfortunately, using prefetch doesn't help. Can you link me a tutorial or example of how flat_map and parallel_interleave are used?
body_text:
@boeddeker , thanks for that information. I'll take a look.
@carlthome , generating a batch is significantly slower than a single training step, so unfortunately, using prefetch doesn't help. Can you link me a tutorial or example of how flat_map and parallel_interleave are used?
body:
@boeddeker , thanks for that information. I'll take a look.

@carlthome , generating a batch is significantly slower than a single training step, so unfortunately, using `prefetch` doesn't help. Can you link me a tutorial or example of how `flat_map` and `parallel_interleave` are used?
